title: Introduction to rebib
text: LaTeX, multiple ways declare bibliography entries, include embedding bibliography entries document isolating section external file commonly called bbl file. BibTeX format, structure much superior managing bibliographic entries. LaTeX problem dealing multiple formats works well bibliographic formats. However, web publishing journals like RJ web articles RJournal support embedded bibliographies. result, need BibTeX equivalent . rebib package converts embedded LaTeX bibliographies close BibTeX equivalent. package eases author manual conversion documents aids texor project automating conversion past RJournal articles RJ-web-article format.

title: Introduction to rebib
text: Reads bib chunks produce close BibTeX equivalent Title author usually mandatory fields URL, ISBN, publisher, pages year optional fields enabled relevant Rest data stored "journal"(internally) "publisher"(writing BibTeX file) Ignores commented LaTeX code Citation tracker Logging events Bibliography Aggregation mindmap summarizes feature set beautifully: mindmap summary feature set rebib package

title: Using rebib in general
text: bibliography converter convert LaTex BBL file given path. way, one can generate BibTeX embedded bibliography BBL file.
code: rebib::biblio_converter(path_to_your_file) #> working directory : /private/var/folders/24/8k48jl6d249_n_qfxwsl6xvm0000gn/T/RtmpYqsT2E/exampledir/standalone #> bib entries : 6 #> Written BibTeX file : /private/var/folders/24/8k48jl6d249_n_qfxwsl6xvm0000gn/T/RtmpYqsT2E/exampledir/standalone/sample.bib

title: Using rebib in general
text: bibliography aggregator append existing BibTeX file bibliographic entries extracted LaTeX BBL file. Flow chart Bibliography Aggregation
code: #> Warning in dir.create(your_article_folder <- file.path(tempdir(), #> "exampledir")): #> '/var/folders/24/8k48jl6d249_n_qfxwsl6xvm0000gn/T//RtmpYqsT2E/exampledir' #> already exists # Suppose you have a example.bib file in your article path cat(readLines(paste(your_article_path,"example.bib",sep="/")),sep = "\n") #> @book{ihaka:1996, #>   author = {{Ihaka, Ross and Gentleman, Robert}}, #>   title = {{R: A Language for Data Analysis and Graphics}}, #>   publisher = {Journal of Computational and Graphical Statistics 3: 299--314}, #>   year = {1996}, #>   url = {https://doi.org/10.1080/10618600.1996.10474713} #> } # for files with BibTeX source as well as embedded entries rebib::aggregate_bibliography(xfun::normalize_path(your_article_path)) #> Found Bib file  example.bib #> bibliography aggregation possible #> Found Bib file  example.bib #> aggregation delta : 2 #> BibTeX file aggregated cat(readLines(paste(your_article_path,"example.bib",sep="/")),sep = "\n") #> @book{ihaka:1996, #>   author = {{Ihaka, Ross and Gentleman, Robert}}, #>   title = {{R: A Language for Data Analysis and Graphics}}, #>   publisher = {Journal of Computational and Graphical Statistics 3: 299--314}, #>   year = {1996}, #>   url = {https://doi.org/10.1080/10618600.1996.10474713} #> } #> @book{R, #> author = {R {Core Team}}, #> title = {{R: A Language and Environment for Statistical Computing}}, #> publisher = {R Foundation for Statistical Computing Vienna Austria    :}, #> year = {2016}, #> url = {https://www.R-project.org/}, #> isbn = {3-900051-07-0} #> } #> @book{Tremblay:2012, #> author = {A.~{Tremblay}}, #> title = {{LMERConvenienceFunctions: A suite of functions to back-fit fixed effects and forward-fit random effects, as well as other miscellaneous functions., }}, #> publisher = {R package version 1.6.8.2}, #> year = {2012}, #> url = {http://CRAN.R-project.org/package=LMERConvenienceFunctions} #> }

what: Stage 1: Read the Embedded Bibliography Block
title: rebib parser mechanics
text: stage minor step reads Embedded Bibliography LaTeX document. step also includes Filtering commented code avoid un-intended entries read. Lastly, data broken based LaTeX macro \\bibitem marker new entry assorted data exported variable.
code: file_name <- rebib:::get_texfile_name(your_article_path) bib_items <- rebib:::extract_embeded_bib_items(your_article_path,file_name) bib_items[[1]] #> [1] "\\bibitem[Ihaka, Ross and Gentleman, Robert]{ihaka:1996}"                           #> [2] "Ihaka, Ross and Gentleman, Robert"                                                  #> [3] "\\newblock \\emph{R: A Language for Data Analysis and Graphics.}"                   #> [4] "\\newblock \\emph{Journal of Computational and Graphical Statistics}, 3:\\penalty0" #> [5] "299--314, 1996."                                                                    #> [6] "\\newblock URL : \\url{https://doi.org/10.1080/10618600.1996.10474713}" bib_items[[2]] #> [1] "\\bibitem[R Core Team]{R}"                                                                   #> [2] "R Core Team"                                                                                 #> [3] "\\newblock R: A Language and Environment for Statistical Computing"                          #> [4] "\\newblock \\emph{R Foundation for Statistical Computing}, Vienna, Austria \\penalty0 2016." #> [5] "\\newblock URL : \\url{https://www.R-project.org/}, ISBN 3-900051-07-0"

title: rebib parser mechanics
text: Now, chunks bibliographic entries, passed parser break based regular expressions. logic use LaTeX macro \\newblock placeholder identify position text elements relative . first value parsed unique_id also called citation reference used cite elements inside article. Usually, first second line whole entry. position unique_id determine position author names. reading unique_id, parser attempt read author name(s) two lines long (Usually case articles). Next, title extracted based position new blocks end bib chunk. way crucial elements bibliographic entry (unique_id, author names title ) parsed . remaining data stored journal internally publisher writing new BibTeX file. series filters ISBN, URL, pages year fields applied search relevant data remaining data. data available set NULL skipped writing BibTeX file. lot filtering common LaTeX elements , data remaining stored structured format written file.
code: bib_items[[1]][1] #> [1] "\\bibitem[Ihaka, Ross and Gentleman, Robert]{ihaka:1996}" bib_items[[1]][2] #> [1] "Ihaka, Ross and Gentleman, Robert" bib_items[[1]][3] #> [1] "\\newblock \\emph{R: A Language for Data Analysis and Graphics.}" bib_items[[1]][4:6] #> [1] "\\newblock \\emph{Journal of Computational and Graphical Statistics}, 3:\\penalty0" #> [2] "299--314, 1996."                                                                    #> [3] "\\newblock URL : \\url{https://doi.org/10.1080/10618600.1996.10474713}" bib_entry <- rebib:::bib_handler(bib_items) bib_entry #> $book #> $book[[1]] #> $book[[1]]$unique_id #> [1] "ihaka:1996" #>  #> $book[[1]]$author #> [1] "Ihaka, Ross and Gentleman, Robert" #>  #> $book[[1]]$title #> [1] "R: A Language for Data Analysis and Graphics" #>  #> $book[[1]]$journal #> [1] "Journal of Computational and Graphical Statistics 3:   :" #>  #> $book[[1]]$year #> [1] "1996" #>  #> $book[[1]]$URL #> [1] "https://doi.org/10.1080/10618600.1996.10474713" #>  #> $book[[1]]$isbn #> NULL #>  #> $book[[1]]$pages #> [1] "299--314" #>  #>  #> $book[[2]] #> $book[[2]]$unique_id #> [1] "R" #>  #> $book[[2]]$author #> [1] "R Core Team" #>  #> $book[[2]]$title #> [1] "R: A Language and Environment for Statistical Computing" #>  #> $book[[2]]$journal #> [1] "R Foundation for Statistical Computing Vienna Austria    :" #>  #> $book[[2]]$year #> [1] "2016" #>  #> $book[[2]]$URL #> [1] "https://www.R-project.org/" #>  #> $book[[2]]$isbn #> [1] "3-900051-07-0" #>  #> $book[[2]]$pages #> NULL #>  #>  #> $book[[3]] #> $book[[3]]$unique_id #> [1] "Tremblay:2012" #>  #> $book[[3]]$author #> [1] "A.~Tremblay" #>  #> $book[[3]]$title #> [1] "LMERConvenienceFunctions: A suite of functions to back-fit fixed effects and forward-fit random effects, as well as other miscellaneous functions., " #>  #> $book[[3]]$journal #> [1] "R package version 1.6.8.2" #>  #> $book[[3]]$year #> [1] "2012" #>  #> $book[[3]]$URL #> [1] "http://CRAN.R-project.org/package=LMERConvenienceFunctions" #>  #> $book[[3]]$isbn #> NULL #>  #> $book[[3]]$pages #> NULL

title: rebib parser mechanics
text: reading bibliographic entries splitting meaningful values , can finally write structured file BibTeX format. writer read bib chunks one time based metadata extracted write corresponding data fields. default entry type book, problems web articles. expect authors converting document take look check errors missing values.
code: #> Warning in file.remove(bib_path): cannot remove file #> '/var/folders/24/8k48jl6d249_n_qfxwsl6xvm0000gn/T//RtmpfNAylb/exampledir/article/example.bib', #> reason 'No such file or directory' rebib:::bibtex_writer(bib_entry,file_path) cat(readLines(paste(your_article_path,"example.bib",sep="/")),sep = "\n") #> @book{ihaka:1996, #> author = {{Ihaka, Ross and Gentleman, Robert}}, #> title = {{R: A Language for Data Analysis and Graphics}}, #> publisher = {Journal of Computational and Graphical Statistics 3:   :}, #> pages = {299--314}, #> year = {1996}, #> url = {https://doi.org/10.1080/10618600.1996.10474713} #> } #> @book{R, #> author = {R {Core Team}}, #> title = {{R: A Language and Environment for Statistical Computing}}, #> publisher = {R Foundation for Statistical Computing Vienna Austria    :}, #> year = {2016}, #> url = {https://www.R-project.org/}, #> isbn = {3-900051-07-0} #> } #> @book{Tremblay:2012, #> author = {A.~{Tremblay}}, #> title = {{LMERConvenienceFunctions: A suite of functions to back-fit fixed effects and forward-fit random effects, as well as other miscellaneous functions., }}, #> publisher = {R package version 1.6.8.2}, #> year = {2012}, #> url = {http://CRAN.R-project.org/package=LMERConvenienceFunctions} #> }

title: Using rebib with RJarticle
code: #> Warning in file.remove(bib_path): cannot remove file #> '/var/folders/24/8k48jl6d249_n_qfxwsl6xvm0000gn/T//Rtmprnewrh/exampledir/article/example.bib', #> reason 'No such file or directory' # for files without BibTeX source rebib::handle_bibliography(your_article_path) #> Warning in get_bib_file(article_dir, file_name): No Bib files found ! #> BibTeX file does not exist #> will parse for bibliography #> bibtex file created cat(readLines(paste(your_article_path,"example.bib",sep="/")),sep = "\n") #> @book{ihaka:1996, #> author = {{Ihaka, Ross and Gentleman, Robert}}, #> title = {{R: A Language for Data Analysis and Graphics}}, #> publisher = {Journal of Computational and Graphical Statistics 3:   :}, #> pages = {299--314}, #> year = {1996}, #> url = {https://doi.org/10.1080/10618600.1996.10474713} #> } #> @book{R, #> author = {R {Core Team}}, #> title = {{R: A Language and Environment for Statistical Computing}}, #> publisher = {R Foundation for Statistical Computing Vienna Austria    :}, #> year = {2016}, #> url = {https://www.R-project.org/}, #> isbn = {3-900051-07-0} #> } #> @book{Tremblay:2012, #> author = {A.~{Tremblay}}, #> title = {{LMERConvenienceFunctions: A suite of functions to back-fit fixed effects and forward-fit random effects, as well as other miscellaneous functions., }}, #> publisher = {R package version 1.6.8.2}, #> year = {2012}, #> url = {http://CRAN.R-project.org/package=LMERConvenienceFunctions} #> }

title: Using rebib with RJarticle
code: # Suppose you have a example.bib file in your article path cat(readLines(paste(your_article_path,"example.bib",sep="/")),sep = "\n") #> @book{ihaka:1996, #>   author = {{Ihaka, Ross and Gentleman, Robert}}, #>   title = {{R: A Language for Data Analysis and Graphics}}, #>   publisher = {Journal of Computational and Graphical Statistics 3: 299--314}, #>   year = {1996}, #>   url = {https://doi.org/10.1080/10618600.1996.10474713} #> } # for files with BibTeX source as well as embedded entries rebib::aggregate_bibliography(xfun::normalize_path(your_article_path)) #> Found Bib file  example.bib #> bibliography aggregation possible #> Found Bib file  example.bib #> aggregation delta : 2 #> BibTeX file aggregated cat(readLines(paste(your_article_path,"example.bib",sep="/")),sep = "\n") #> @book{ihaka:1996, #>   author = {{Ihaka, Ross and Gentleman, Robert}}, #>   title = {{R: A Language for Data Analysis and Graphics}}, #>   publisher = {Journal of Computational and Graphical Statistics 3: 299--314}, #>   year = {1996}, #>   url = {https://doi.org/10.1080/10618600.1996.10474713} #> } #> @book{R, #> author = {R {Core Team}}, #> title = {{R: A Language and Environment for Statistical Computing}}, #> publisher = {R Foundation for Statistical Computing Vienna Austria    :}, #> year = {2016}, #> url = {https://www.R-project.org/}, #> isbn = {3-900051-07-0} #> } #> @book{Tremblay:2012, #> author = {A.~{Tremblay}}, #> title = {{LMERConvenienceFunctions: A suite of functions to back-fit fixed effects and forward-fit random effects, as well as other miscellaneous functions., }}, #> publisher = {R package version 1.6.8.2}, #> year = {2012}, #> url = {http://CRAN.R-project.org/package=LMERConvenienceFunctions} #> }

title: Convert and Aggregate Bibliographies
text: rebib spun-package texor. decision fact bibliography section texor package expanding significantly, enough deserve dedicated space. Reads bib chunks produce close BibTeX equivalent Title author usually mandatory fields URL, ISBN, publisher, pages year optional fields enabled relevant Rest data stored "journal"(internally) "publisher"(writing BibTeX file) Ignores commented LaTeX code Citation tracker Logging events Bibliography Aggregation

title: Convert and Aggregate Bibliographies
text: install mainline version CRAN : install development version GitHub :
code: install.packages('rebib') # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("Abhi-1U/rebib") # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("Abhi-1U/rebib")

title: Convert and Aggregate Bibliographies
text: quick example use rebib package sample Rjournal article (included package inst/article)
code: wd <-  system.file("article", package = "rebib") # for files without BibTeX source rebib::handle_bibliography(wd) cat(readLines(paste(wd,"example.bib",sep="/")),sep = "\n") # for files with BibTeX source as well as embedded enntries rebib::aggregate_bibliography(wd) cat(readLines(paste(wd,"example.bib",sep="/")),sep = "\n")

what: General Usage for any other tex/bbl file
title: Convert and Aggregate Bibliographies
text: quick example use rebib package sample bbl file (included package inst/article)
code: bbl_file <-  "" # /path/to/bbl_file rebib::biblio_convertor(file_path = bbl_file) cat(readLines(xfun::with_ext(bbl_file, "bib")),sep = "\n")

title: Convert and Aggregate Bibliographies
text: procedure meant debugging errors finding went wrong.
code: wd <-  system.file("article", package = "rebib") file_name <- rebib:::get_texfile_name(wd) bib_items <- rebib:::extract_embeded_bib_items(wd,file_name) # for debugging single entry rebib:::bibliography_parser(bib_items[1]) # for multiple entries rebib:::bib_handler(bib_items[1:2])

title: Convert and Aggregate Bibliographies
text: Embedded bibliography : generated BibTeX :
code:
ibitem[R Core Team]{R} R Core Team 
ewblock R: A Language and Environment for Statistical Computing 
ewblock \emph{R Foundation for Statistical Computing}, Vienna, Austria \penalty0 2016. 
ewblock URL : \url{https://www.R-project.org/}, ISBN 3-900051-07-0 @book{R, author = {{R Core Team}}, title = {{R: A Language and Environment for Statistical Computing}}, publisher = {R Foundation for Statistical Computing Vienna Austria}, year = {2016}, url = {https://www.R-project.org/}, isbn = {3-900051-07-0} }

title: rebib : Parse/Convert embedded LaTeX bibliography to BibTex
text: install mainline version CRAN : install development version GitHub :
code: install.packages('rebib') # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("Abhi-1U/rebib") # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("Abhi-1U/rebib")

title: rebib : Parse/Convert embedded LaTeX bibliography to BibTex
text: quick example use rebib package sample Rjournal article (included package inst/article)
code: wd <-  system.file("article", package = "rebib") # for files without BibTeX source rebib::handle_bibliography(wd) cat(readLines(paste(wd,"example.bib",sep="/")),sep = "\n") # for files with BibTeX source as well as embedded enntries rebib::aggregate_bibliography(wd) cat(readLines(paste(wd,"example.bib",sep="/")),sep = "\n")

code: dir.create(your_article_folder <- file.path(tempdir(), "exampledir")) example_files <-  system.file("aggr_example", package = "rebib") x <- file.copy(from = example_files,to=your_article_folder,recursive = TRUE) your_article_path <- paste(your_article_folder,"aggr_example",sep="/") rebib::aggregate_bibliography(your_article_path) #> Found Bib file  example.bib #> bibliography aggregation possible #> Found Bib file  example.bib #> aggregation delta : 2 #> BibTeX file aggregated readLines(paste(your_article_path,"example.bib",sep="/")) #>  [1] title: bibliography converter — biblio_converter
code: test_file <- system.file("standalone/test.bbl", package = "rebib") dir.create(your_article_folder <- file.path(tempdir(), "testdir")) file.copy(test_file, your_article_folder) #> [1] TRUE your_article_path <- xfun::normalize_path(paste(your_article_folder,"test.bbl",sep="/")) rebib::biblio_converter(file_path = your_article_path) #> working directory : /private/var/folders/24/8k48jl6d249_n_qfxwsl6xvm0000gn/T/Rtmp2J1Fk6/testdir #> bib entries : 8 #> Written BibTeX file : /private/var/folders/24/8k48jl6d249_n_qfxwsl6xvm0000gn/T/Rtmp2J1Fk6/testdir/test.bib head(readLines(xfun::with_ext(your_article_path,"bib"))) #> [1] "@book{montes96,"                                                        #> [2] "author = {M.J.~{Montes}},"                                              #> [3] "title = {{Butcher's Algorithm for Calculating the Date of Easter in}}," #> [4] "publisher = {the Gregorian Calendar},"                                  #> [5] "year = {1996}"                                                          #> [6] "}"                                                                      unlink(your_article_folder,recursive = TRUE)

title: function to solve bibliography problems — handle_bibliography
text: article_dir path directory contains tex article override_mode force use parser ignore BibTeX bibliography. log_rebib option enable log files rebib

title: function to solve bibliography problems — handle_bibliography
text: bibliography links bibtex file latex source code generates minimal bibtex file embedded bibliography links file latex file

title: function to solve bibliography problems — handle_bibliography
code: dir.create(your_article_folder <- file.path(tempdir(), "exampledir")) example_files <-  system.file("article", package = "rebib") x <- file.copy(from = example_files,to=your_article_folder,recursive = TRUE) your_article_path <- paste(your_article_folder,"article",sep="/") rebib::handle_bibliography(your_article_path) #> Warning: No Bib files found ! #> BibTeX file does not exist #> will parse for bibliography #> bibtex file created unlink(your_article_folder,recursive = TRUE)

code: dir.create(your_article_folder <- file.path(tempdir(), "exampledir")) example_files <-  system.file("article", package = "rebib") x <- file.copy(from = example_files,to=your_article_folder,recursive = TRUE) your_article_path <- paste(your_article_folder,"article",sep="/") rebib::log_setup(your_article_path, "log-file.log", 2) unlink(your_article_folder,recursive = TRUE)

title: log messages for various categories — rebib_log
code: dir.create(your_article_folder <- file.path(tempdir(), "exampledir")) example_files <-  system.file("article", package = "rebib") x <- file.copy(from = example_files,to=your_article_folder,recursive = TRUE) your_article_path <- paste(your_article_folder,"article",sep="/") rebib::log_setup(your_article_path, "log-file.log", 2) rebib::rebib_log("Hello", "INFO", 2) #> NULL cat(readLines(paste(your_article_path,"/log-file.log",sep="")),sep="\n") #> INFO [2023-05-27 05:25:28] Hello unlink(your_article_folder,recursive = TRUE)

title: split BibTex references — split_bibtex_references

title: split BibTex references — split_bibtex_references
code: split_bibtex_references(bib_path)

title: split BibTex references — split_bibtex_references
text: bib_path path bibtex file read

title: split BibTex references — split_bibtex_references
text: list references separated types names based indices

title: split BibTex references — split_bibtex_references
code: dir.create(your_article_folder <- file.path(tempdir(), "exampledir")) example_files <-  system.file("article", package = "rebib") x <- file.copy(from = example_files,to=your_article_folder,recursive = TRUE) your_article_path <- paste(your_article_folder,"article",sep="/") bib_path <- paste0(your_article_path,"/example.bib") rebib::handle_bibliography(your_article_path) #> Warning: No Bib files found ! #> BibTeX file does not exist #> will parse for bibliography #> bibtex file created references <- rebib::split_bibtex_references(bib_path) references #> $types #> [1] "book" "book" "book" #>  #> $names #> [1] "{ihaka:1996}"    "{R}"             "{Tremblay:2012}" #>  unlink(your_article_folder,recursive = TRUE)

Use message()/warning() instead print() Examples/Tests/Vignettes write user/package directory work temp directory. Fixed .exit() call R/util.R, move line 64 line 22. Fixed title description DESCRIPTION file
